text: Hi everyone! Recently change company currency on our side - does anyone have best practices on how to bulk update closed deal amounts? :slightly_smiling_face:

Export Current Deal Data: First, export all relevant closed deals from HubSpot, including deal IDs, amounts, close dates, and any other necessary fields.

Convert Amounts to New Currency: In your export, convert all deal amounts to the new currency using the correct exchange rates at the time each deal closed. Ensure these values align with accounting records, if possible.

Format Consistently: Make sure your currency field in the spreadsheet is formatted consistently (no symbols, correct decimal places, etc.).
Thank you - I have done the export and conversion but struggling to update the 'amount in company currency' via an import
You’re welcome, do you have multiple currencies within your portal?
No we only have GBP and now USD
Then you will need to make sure the currency is mapped to the currency code field while doing the import i.e: GBP or USD actually
Perfect, will do. But when importing the 'amount in company currency' is greyed out - is there a way to change the amounts in that field?

This should work, see screenshot.

Have you set up the currencies under _Settings_ > _Account_ _Defaults_ > _Currency_?

Currencies must be "created" here before you can import deals and assign those currencies; this requires a Starter subscription.
Ah okay thanks - does that feed back into the 'amount in company currency' seeing as it is a HS created field?
Yes! Let me know if you want further help :blush:
Amazing - thanks for your help!
seems like the GBP amounts in 'amount in company currency' still remains in GBP, just with $ in front

Go to *Settings > Account Defaults > Currency* 

What is shown there?
we don't use the Euro and SEK

Ah okay so the company currency here might be the reason. HubSpot allows individual deals to be tracked in different currencies. Even if your company currency is set to GBP, some deals may still be saved in USD if they were initially created with USD as the currency. In that case, update it to GBP and HubSpot should convert deal amounts to the new currency going forward.
Again this should be good to go moving forward while doing the deal import, I suggest trying it out with one deal first to check how it works.
Yes all deals going forward should be good, but we are trying to update all deals that have already closed - but it looks like this will have to be a  manual switch for historic deals

The import of the exported deals should work to be honest, as long as you do the currency mapping. Are you on a free plan or something?

Another way is to create a new deal property to park the deal amounts then use a workflow to clear the deal amounts and copy it from that property.

appreciate your help, it works for deals that aren't closed yet but for all closed deals it stays in the original amount (GBP) but just has the $ now instead of £. We're on enterprise but will do some further digging, thanks!
are you saying that column is gone from the snowflake database? And you're asking here how to recover that?
